Package com.microblink.view.ocrResult

Class OcrResultDotsView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.microblink.view.ocrResult.OcrResultDotsView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, com.microblink.hardware.orientation.OrientationChangeListener, IOcrResultView, com.microblink.view.viewfinder.IDetectionView, IDisplayablePointsView
    public class OcrResultDotsView
extends android.view.ViewGroup
implements IOcrResultView, IDisplayablePointsView, com.microblink.hardware.orientation.OrientationChangeListener
    View intended to be used as child view to RecognizerRunnerView It differs from OcrResultView as it renders mNumberOfDots dots as subviews and displays them along a line of detection. It is recommended to be used as replacement for OcrResultView on low-end devices as showing dots as replacement for showing characters is significantly faster on large detections.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_NUMBER_OF_DOTS

        public static final int DEFAULT_NUMBER_OF_DOTS
        default maximum number of dots being displayed (necessary for bitmap caching)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • OcrResultDotsView

        public OcrResultDotsView​(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context,
                         int hostActivityOrientation,
                         @Nullable
                         Orientation initialRecognizerOrientation)
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in.
        hostActivityOrientation - host's screen orientation. Can be obtained by using BaseCameraView.getHostScreenOrientation() Possible values are: ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT, ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_REVERSE_PORTRAIT, ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE, ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_REVERSE_LANDSCAPE.
        initialRecognizerOrientation - initial orientation of RecognizerRunnerView rotatable view. Can be obtained by using BaseCameraView.getInitialOrientation(). If set to null or Orientation.ORIENTATION_UNKNOWN recognizer orientation will be set to Orientation.ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT.

      • OcrResultDotsView

        public OcrResultDotsView​(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context,
                         int hostActivityOrientation,
                         @Nullable
                         Orientation initialRecognizerOrientation,
                         int numberOfDots)
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in.
        hostActivityOrientation - host's screen orientation. Can be obtained by using BaseCameraView.getHostScreenOrientation() Possible values are: ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT, ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_REVERSE_PORTRAIT, ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE, ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_REVERSE_LANDSCAPE.
        initialRecognizerOrientation - initial orientation of RecognizerRunnerView rotatable view. Can be obtained by using BaseCameraView.getInitialOrientation(). If set to null or Orientation.ORIENTATION_UNKNOWN recognizer orientation will be set to Orientation.ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT.
        numberOfDots - maximum number of dots being displayed.

      • setHostActivityOrientation

        public void setHostActivityOrientation​(int hostActivityOrientation)
        Description copied from interface: com.microblink.view.viewfinder.IDetectionView
        Sets the host activity orientation code. This information is important if view draws its content based on the activity orientation.
        Specified by:
        setHostActivityOrientation in interface com.microblink.view.viewfinder.IDetectionView
        Parameters:
        hostActivityOrientation - host activity orientation code. Valid codes are:
        • android.content.pm.ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT
        • android.content.pm.ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_REVERSE_PORTRAIT
        • android.content.pm.ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE

      • addOcrResult

        public void addOcrResult​(@NonNull
                         DisplayableOcrResult result)
        Method to add new DisplayableOcrResult, preferably from OcrCallback.onOcrResult(DisplayableOcrResult) method. For each result it ads its lines in line animation queue. Lines with length less then 2 chars are ignored. After addition animation is called.
        Specified by:
        addOcrResult in interface IOcrResultView
        Parameters:
        result - OCR result to display

      • setOcrResult

                         DisplayableOcrResult result)
        Clears line animation queue and calls addOcrResult(DisplayableOcrResult) with given result.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • setDetectionRelativeDestination

        public void setDetectionRelativeDestination​(@Nullable
                                            android.graphics.RectF detectionRelativeDestination)
        Description copied from interface: com.microblink.view.viewfinder.IDetectionView
        Sets position of the destination view in which the detection will be shown, relative to processed frame. View position is required for performing further transformation of detection coordinates in order to display detection correctly on the destination view.
        Specified by:
        setDetectionRelativeDestination in interface com.microblink.view.viewfinder.IDetectionView
        Parameters:
        detectionRelativeDestination - position of the destination view where detection will be shown, relative to processed frame. Set to null if no further transformation is needed in cases when destination view matches the processed part of the recognized frame.
